page.title: 20LOCAL SUPERSTITIONS,CATON
page.content: There are many legends and tales about Gresgarth Hall.One is that a Cavalier is bricked up in the beer cellar.A secret passage is supposed to run under Artlebeck up in Jenkins wood.A man and woman are thought to have been murdered under the weeping ash,a tree in the grounds.The ghost of a monk walks the passages and bedclothes are removed mysteriously from people sleeping in certain rooms. The ghost of a 17th century lady is said to walk from the Black Bull Inn to St. PaulÂ£s church yard.On the path to Forge Bridge there is a ring of standing stones.If you pass through the ring on a certain day you will die within twelve months.Going through the red gates on Quernmore Rd.invites a similar fate. These pages were compiled by 4th year pupils of Caton St.Paul's C.E.school.
